TAO LYU (吕涛)

Ph.D. Student
Computer and Communication Sciences (IC)
École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL)

lvtao@iie.ac.cn       CV     Google Scholar     Blog

Biography

I'm an EDIC Ph.D. student at EPFL. I received my bachelor and master degree from Huazhong University of Science and Technology and University of Chinese Academy of Sciences respectively.

I am broadly interested in operating systems, software engineering and computer security at all layers (e.g., software,system and hardware security). Recently, I focus on distributed system security, like finding bugs in distributed file systems.

Publications

  1. RTFM! Automatic Assumption Discovery and Verification Derivation from Library Document for API Misuse Detection
    Tao Lv, Ruishi Li, Yi Yang, Kai Chen, Xiaojing Liao, XiaoFeng Wang, Peiwei Hu and Luyi Xing.
    In Proceedings of the 27th ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS 2020).
  2. FuzzGuard: Filtering out Unreachable Inputs in Directed Grey-box Fuzzing through Deep Learning
    Peiyuan Zong, Tao Lv, Dawei Wang, Zizhuang Deng, Ruigang Liang and Kai Chen.
    In Proceedings of the 29th USENIX Security Symposium (USENIX Security 2020).

Internship Experiences

  • NSFOCUS(绿盟), Security Service Engineer, Xi'an, China July 2018­ - August 2018

Professional Skills

  • Vulnerability discovery: Proficient in fuzzing and static analysis (e.g., CodeQL).
  • Program analysis techniques: Taint analysis, symbolic execution, software reversing and writing LLVM Pass.
  • Natural language processing: Preliminary in sentiment analysis, dependency parsing, word embedding, Part-of-speech tagging and shallow parsing.
  • Programming language: Proficient in C, Python and x86_64 assembly language.
